sections.title: Service and Claim Details
sections.content:
Dear Claims Review Department,

We are writing to formally appeal the denial of the following service(s) provided by City General Hospital on 2026-01-10:

  • Outpatient Physical Therapy (CPT: 97110) — Billed Amount: USD 450.00 — Status: DENIED

Please review the complete record and clinical justification presented below.

citations.snippet:
Service: Outpatient Physical Therapy (CPT 97110)
Requested Amount: $450.00
Status: DENIED
citations.label: services

citations.snippet: January 10, 2026
citations.label: serviceDate

citations.snippet: City General Hospital
citations.label: providerName

sections.title: Request for Review
sections.content: We respectfully request that you reverse this denial and approve payment for the services rendered for claim number 987654321. We have enclosed all supporting clinical documentation and evidence demonstrating that this service is covered and medically warranted.

citations.snippet: Claim Number: 987654321
citations.label: claimNumber

sections.title: Summary of Denial Reason
sections.content:
In your letter dated 2026-02-21, you denied coverage for the above service(s) citing Clinical Policy Bulletin #045 (Physical Therapy Session Limits), stating:

"Based on the clinical documentation provided, the requested services have been determined to be not medically necessary. Under your Plan's Clinical Policy Bulletin #045, physical therapy for this diagnosis is limited to 12 sessions per calendar year unless significant functional improvement is documented. Our records show you have reached your benefit limit for this period."

We respectfully contest this determination on the grounds set forth below.

citations.snippet: Based on the clinical documentation provided, the requested services have been determined to be not medically necessary. Under your Plan's Clinical Policy Bulletin #045, physical therapy for this diagnosis is limited to 12 sessions per calendar year
citations.label: denialReason

citations.snippet: Clinical Policy Bulletin #045
citations.label: policyReferences

citations.snippet: Date: February 21, 2026
citations.label: letterDate

sections.title: Rebuttal and Supporting Arguments
sections.content:
REBUTTAL — Benefit Limit Exception

Your denial references Clinical Policy Bulletin #045, which limits coverage under standard circumstances.

We assert that this patient's circumstances warrant an exception for the following reasons:

1. Documented Medical Necessity: The treating provider has determined that continued services are medically necessary. [NEEDS EVIDENCE: PT progress notes documenting current functional status and deficits]

2. Functional Improvement: [NEEDS EVIDENCE: PT progress notes showing functional improvement measurements (e.g., outcome scores, range of motion, pain scale)].

3. Session Count Verification: We request verification of the session count used in this determination. If any sessions were miscounted or improperly attributed, the limit has not been reached. [NEEDS EVIDENCE: payer's session count record for this member and benefit year]

Accordingly, we request that the payer invoke its medical necessity exception process and approve additional sessions as documented by the treating provider.

sections.title: Enclosed Documentation
sections.content:
The following documents are enclosed in support of this appeal:

1. Appeal Request Form
2. Letter from your doctor explaining why the service was necessary
3. Additional medical records
4. Physician / provider letter of medical necessity
5. Functional outcome measures
6. Completed Appeal Request Form
7. Copy of original denial letter
8. Proof of appeal submission

citations.snippet: Complete the enclosed Appeal Request Form. Attach any additional records or a letter from your doctor explaining why the service was necessary.
citations.label: requiredAttachments

sections.title: Closing and Signature
sections.content:
This appeal is time-sensitive; please process within your standard internal appeal timeline.

We trust you will give this appeal full and fair consideration. We are available to provide any additional documentation you require.

If you have any questions, please contact us at 555-867-5309.

Sincerely,

Jane Doe
Member / Patient Representative

Submission method: mail or fax

fullText:
February 21, 2026

Jane Doe

HEALTH INSURANCE COMPANY
123 Benefit Lane | Claims Department

Re: INTERNAL APPEAL — Denial of Claim
Member Name: Jane Doe
Member ID: XYZ123456789
Claim Number: 987654321
Date of Original Denial Letter: 2026-02-21
[CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:88-108] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:109-135] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:136-161] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:0-24] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:62-87]

────────────────────────────────────────

Dear Claims Review Department,

We are writing to formally appeal the denial of the following service(s) provided by City General Hospital on 2026-01-10:

  • Outpatient Physical Therapy (CPT: 97110) — Billed Amount: USD 450.00 — Status: DENIED

Please review the complete record and clinical justification presented below.
[CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:321-420] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:288-308] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:240-261]

────────────────────────────────────────

We respectfully request that you reverse this denial and approve payment for the services rendered for claim number 987654321. We have enclosed all supporting clinical documentation and evidence demonstrating that this service is covered and medically warranted.
[CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:136-161]

────────────────────────────────────────

In your letter dated 2026-02-21, you denied coverage for the above service(s) citing Clinical Policy Bulletin #045 (Physical Therapy Session Limits), stating:

"Based on the clinical documentation provided, the requested services have been determined to be not medically necessary. Under your Plan's Clinical Policy Bulletin #045, physical therapy for this diagnosis is limited to 12 sessions per calendar year unless significant functional improvement is documented. Our records show you have reached your benefit limit for this period."

We respectfully contest this determination on the grounds set forth below.
[CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:430-790] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:497-527] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:62-87]

────────────────────────────────────────

REBUTTAL — Benefit Limit Exception

Your denial references Clinical Policy Bulletin #045, which limits coverage under standard circumstances.

We assert that this patient's circumstances warrant an exception for the following reasons:

1. Documented Medical Necessity: The treating provider has determined that continued services are medically necessary. [NEEDS EVIDENCE: PT progress notes documenting current functional status and deficits]

2. Functional Improvement: [NEEDS EVIDENCE: PT progress notes showing functional improvement measurements (e.g., outcome scores, range of motion, pain scale)].

3. Session Count Verification: We request verification of the session count used in this determination. If any sessions were miscounted or improperly attributed, the limit has not been reached. [NEEDS EVIDENCE: payer's session count record for this member and benefit year]

Accordingly, we request that the payer invoke its medical necessity exception process and approve additional sessions as documented by the treating provider.
[CITE:kbChunk:kb_policy_cpb045:0-817] [CITE:kbChunk:kb_prior_appeal_pt_001:0-892] [CITE:kbChunk:kb_prior_appeal_pt_001:0-897] [CITE:kbChunk:kb_policy_cpb045:0-890]

────────────────────────────────────────

The following documents are enclosed in support of this appeal:

1. Appeal Request Form
2. Letter from your doctor explaining why the service was necessary
3. Additional medical records
4. Physician / provider letter of medical necessity
5. Functional outcome measures
6. Completed Appeal Request Form
7. Copy of original denial letter
8. Proof of appeal submission
[CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:1010-1100]

────────────────────────────────────────

This appeal is time-sensitive; please process within your standard internal appeal timeline.

We trust you will give this appeal full and fair consideration. We are available to provide any additional documentation you require.

If you have any questions, please contact us at 555-867-5309.

Sincerely,

Jane Doe
Member / Patient Representative

Submission method: mail or fax
[CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:88-108] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:930-990] [CITE:denialCaseSpan:doc_sample_denial:1050-1120]

actionItems.action: Confirm and calendar the appeal deadline: 180 days from the denial letter date. File before this date to preserve your rights.
actionItems.why: Missing the appeal deadline permanently waives your right to an internal appeal.

citations.snippet: You must submit your request in writing within 180 days of receiving this letter.
citations.label: appealWindowDays

actionItems.action: Contact provider to obtain: (1) progress notes for all sessions, (2) functional outcome measures, (3) physician letter of medical necessity. These are your strongest evidence.
actionItems.why: Benefit limit exceptions require documented functional improvement and clinical necessity.

actionItems.action: Request a physician letter of medical necessity addressing the specific denial reason, functional deficits, and why additional services are warranted.
actionItems.why: A physician's direct attestation carries significant weight in the clinical review process.

citations.snippet: Based on the clinical documentation provided, the requested services have been determined to be not medically necessary. Under your Plan's Clinical Policy Bulletin #045, physical therapy for this diagnosis is limited to 12 sessions per calendar year
citations.label: denialReason

actionItems.action: Review retrieved policy excerpts for Clinical Policy Bulletin #045 and ensure your clinical documentation satisfies every listed criterion.
actionItems.why: Rebutting a policy-specific denial requires demonstrating compliance with that exact policy's criteria.

citations.snippet: Clinical Policy Bulletin #045
citations.label: policyReferences

actionItems.action: Submit appeal via mail or fax and obtain proof of submission (certified mail receipt, fax confirmation, or portal upload confirmation).
actionItems.why: Proof of timely submission protects you if the payer claims non-receipt.

citations.snippet: Mail or fax your appeal to the address listed at the top of this letter.
citations.label: submissionMethods

actionItems.action: Resolve missing evidence items before submission: PT progress notes documenting current functional status and deficits; PT progress notes showing functional improvement measurements (e.g., outcome scores, range of motion, pain scale); payer's session count record for this member and benefit year.
actionItems.why: NEEDS EVIDENCE placeholders in the letter indicate gaps that weaken the appeal.
